description: Numbers that are congruent to {1, 2, 4, 5} mod 8.
links: Bruno Berselli, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1,0,0,1,-1).
mathematica: Select[Range[120], MemberQ[{1, 2, 4, 5}, Mod[#, 8]] &] (* or *) LinearRecurrence[{1, 0, 0, 1, -1}, {1, 2, 4, 5, 9}, 60] (* _Bruno Berselli_, Jul 17 2012 *)
prog: Contribution from _Bruno Berselli_, Jul 17 2012: (Start)(MAGMA) [n: n in [1..120] | n mod 8 in [1,2,4,5]];(Maxima) makelist(2*n-2-((-1)^n+%i^(n*(n+1)))/2,n,1,60);(PARI) Vec((1+x+2*x^2+x^3+3*x^4)/((1+x)*(1-x)^2*(1+x^2))+O(x^60)) (End)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
